titles.title: To protect the creditworthiness of the United States and avoid default of the United States Government.

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on Rules.
Consideration initiated question of privileges of the House.
Members were recognized to speak on whether the resolution constituted a question of privilege.
The Chair announced that the resolution did not constitute a question of the privilege.
Mr. Volkmer moved to appeal the ruling of the Chair.
Mr. Solomon moved to table the motion to appeal the ruling of the Chair.
Motion to appeal the ruling of the Chair tabled.
On motion to table the appeal of the ruling of the Chair Agreed to by recorded vote: 229 - 187 (Roll No. 26).
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

bill.summary: 2/1/1996--Introduced. Directs the enrolling clerk of the House of Representatives to prepare an engrossment of, and transmit to the Senate, H.R. 2409 (public debt limit), which shall be deemed to have passed the House.
